content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Coal Mining Operation at (-14.0, -15.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (24.0, -15.0) mining coal
- Wooden chest (23.5, -16.5) storing coal with 210 units

###Iron Mining Operation at (-14.0, 23.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (-14.0, 23.0) mining iron ore
- Wooden chest (-14.5, 21.5) storing iron ore with 782 units

###Copper Processing Line at (20.0, 20.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (20.0, 20.0) mining copper ore
- Wooden chest (20.5, 21.5) storing copper ore with 133 units
- Stone furnace (24.0, 20.0) for smelting copper plates
- Wooden chest (24.5, 17.5) storing copper plates with 53 units
- Burner inserter (24.5, 18.5) moving items from furnace to output chest
- Wooden chest (22.5, 21.5) storing copper ore with 401 units
- Burner inserter (22.5, 20.5) moving items from input chest to furnace

###Unused Furnaces
Two stone furnaces at:
- Position (-11.0, 20.0)
- Position (-9.0, 20.0)
Both currently inactive with no ingredients

ERROR TIPS

### Errors when placing entities in occupied spaces
- Before placing an entity, verify the target location is clear of other entities
- The attempt to place burner inserter at (23.0, 20.5) failed because another entity was occupying that space
- Consider checking surrounding tiles for available space before placement

### Furnace efficiency issues
- Multiple furnaces are idle due to lack of ingredients despite having fuel
- Ensure proper connection between input inserters and material supply
- Verify inserter pickup and drop positions align with furnace input positions

### Resource management
- Some mining drills are running low on fuel (as low as 1 coal)
- Implement a fuel management system to keep mining operations running continuously
- Consider setting up automated fuel insertion for mining drills and inserters
